page.title: 04Brymore School,Cannington.
page.content: Brymore was opened in September 1952.Brymore is a Secondary Technical School of Agriculture for boys.It was established by the Somerset Education Commitee.It is situated in a large country house,part of which dates back to the 15th century. Brymore was the family home of John Pym,the great parliamentarian.The school can accommodate 150 boarders and up to 50 dayboys. There are 36 acres of pleasant grounds.The staffing establishment in 1985/6 is a Head plus 14 teachers. The school farm has a small dairy herd,beef animals,sows,a small flock of ewes with lambs and at times a small flock of poultry.
